Notes: Mirror nodes distribute telemetry feeds and align with InfoComm communication node semantics.
Hiero shards are treated as network segments for telemetry routing.
Telemetry exchanges document data flows analogous to InfoComm exchange processes.
Telemetry routing references the shard segment carrying ESG data.
Mirror APIs describe the communication node responsible for delivery.
Dataset publication aligns with InfoComm interface exposure requirements.
SLA policies govern telemetry distribution per InfoComm agreements.
Latency metrics provide the quantitative measure expected by InfoComm.
